Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.sessions

[Java] Class DefaultSession

      • gov.noaa.messageapi.sessions.DefaultSession
      • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
        ISession

        public class DefaultSession
extends BaseSession

        A default session is used for producing default requests. The request is clean, in the sense that a new request gets its own copy of session properties on creation - and is publish focused, in the sense that the request is designed for publishing data to arbitrary endpoints through a protocol.

        Authors:
        Ryan Berkheimer

        • Constructor Summary

            Constructors 
            Constructor and description
            DefaultSession (IContainer c, IProtocol p, ISchema s)
            Constructs a new publish session from existing container, protocol, and schema objects.
            DefaultSession (java.lang.String sessionSpec)
            Constructs a new publish session directly from a text map.

        • Methods Summary

            Methods 
            Type Params Return Type Name and description
            IRequest createRequest()
            Creates a clean publish request (deep copy), using the session parameters for the request constructor

        • Constructor Detail

          • public DefaultSession(IContainer c, IProtocol p, ISchema s)

            Constructs a new publish session from existing container, protocol, and schema objects.

            Parameters:
            c - An IContainer object
            p - An IProtocol object
            s - An ISchema object

          • public DefaultSession(java.lang.String sessionSpec)

            Constructs a new publish session directly from a text map. The text map should contain all the properties needed for Session Construction.

            throws:
            Exception Throws exception if error creating session
            Parameters:
            sessionSpec - A text based map containing session construction parameters

        • Method Detail

          • public IRequest createRequest()

            Creates a clean publish request (deep copy), using the session parameters for the request constructor

            Returns:
            returns the created request
